title: SEC Settles With 17 Firms Over Fund Fees
text:
Text size

Zach Gibson/Bloomberg

More wealth management firms – 17 to be exact – have settled with the SEC as part of the agency’s crackdown on insufficient disclosures of mutual fund fees, InvestmentNews reports.

Newsletter Sign-up

The firms have agreed to pay back almost $10 million to investors. Sixteen of the firms self-reported under an SEC initiative launched in February 2018. That means that even though they must reimburse investors, they won’t have to pay penalties. One of the firms that settled, Mid Atlantic Financial Management Inc., did not self-report and will pay a $300,000 civil penalty in addition to $1 million in disgorgement. Among the other firms that settled were Essex Financial Services, Independent Financial Group, Saxony Capital Management and Wedbush Securities.
description: Seventeen firms agree to reimburse investors for insufficient disclosures related to mutual fund fees.
